SVGMarkerElement.summary: The SVGMarkerElement interface provides access to the properties of marker elements, as well as methods to manipulate them. The marker element defines the graphics used for drawing marks on a shape.

remarks.para: The following properties and methods all return, or act on the attributes of the marker element represented by SVGMarkerElement.

SVGMarkerElementMarkerHeight.summary: The markerHeight read-only property of the interface returns an object containing the height of the {{SVGElement("marker")}} viewport as defined by the {{SVGattr("markerHeight")}} attribute.
SVGMarkerElementMarkerHeight.value: An object. The baseVal property of this object returns an , the value of which returns the height.

SVGMarkerElementMarkerUnits.summary: The markerUnits read-only property of the interface returns an object. This object returns an integer which represents the keyword values that the {{SVGattr("markerUnits")}} attribute accepts.
SVGMarkerElementMarkerUnits.value: An object. The baseVal property of this object contains one of the following values:

SVGMarkerElementMarkerWidth.summary: The markerWidth read-only property of the interface returns an object containing the width of the {{SVGElement("marker")}} viewport as defined by the {{SVGattr("markerWidth")}} attribute.
SVGMarkerElementMarkerWidth.value: An object. The baseVal property of this object returns an , the value of which returns the width.

SVGMarkerElementOrientAngle.summary: The orientAngle read-only property of the interface returns an object containing the angle of the {{SVGattr("orient")}} attribute.
SVGMarkerElementOrientAngle.value: An object. The baseVal property of this object returns an , the value of which returns the angle.

SVGMarkerElementOrientType.summary: The orientType read-only property of the interface returns an object indicating whether the {{SVGattr("orient")}} attribute is auto, an angle value, or something else.

remarks.para: This something else is most likely to be the keyword auto-start-reverse however the spec leaves it open for this to be other values. Unsupported values will generally be thrown away by the parser, leaving the value the default of auto.

SVGMarkerElementOrientType.value: An object. This contains one of the following values:

SVGMarkerElementPreserveAspectRatio.summary: The preserveAspectRatio read-only property of the interface returns an object containing the value of the {{SVGattr("preserveAspectRatio")}} attribute of the {{SVGElement("marker")}}.
SVGMarkerElementPreserveAspectRatio.value: An object. The baseVal property of this object returns an object, with the following properties:

SVGMarkerElementRefX.summary: The refX read-only property of the interface returns an object containing the value of the {{SVGattr("refX")}} attribute of the {{SVGElement("marker")}}.
SVGMarkerElementRefX.value: An object. The baseVal property of this object returns an , the value of which returns the refX.

SVGMarkerElementRefY.summary: The refY read-only property of the interface returns an object containing the value of the {{SVGattr("refY")}} attribute of the {{SVGElement("marker")}}.
SVGMarkerElementRefY.value: An object. The baseVal property of this object returns an , the value of which returns the refY.

SVGMarkerElementSetOrientToAngle.summary: The setOrientToAngle() method of the interface sets the value of the orient attribute to the value in the passed in.

SVGMarkerElementSetOrientToAuto.summary: The setOrientToAuto() method of the interface sets the value of the orient attribute to auto.

SVGMarkerElementViewBox.summary: The viewBox read-only property of the interface returns an object which contains the values set by the {{SVGattr("viewBox")}} attribute on the {{SVGElement("marker")}}.
SVGMarkerElementViewBox.value: An object. The baseVal property of this object returns an object, from which can be returned the x and y co-ordinates, plus the width and height of the marker {{SVGattr("viewBox")}} attribute.
